description.narrative: Output 5.5. Poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries continue to receive lifesaving unconditional emergency cash transfer, which contributes to Economic And Social Policy General, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Yemen's policy environment, legislation and systems are strengthened to protect and promote children's rights, especially the most disadvantaged.

participating-org.narrative: UNITED NATIONS OFFICE FOR PROJECT SERVICES

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context)

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.5. Poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries continue to receive lifesaving unconditional emergency cash transfer

description.narrative: Three payments have taken place in 2019, covering 1.41 million poor and vulnerable beneficiaries of the emergency cash programme, impacting over 9 million people - almost a third of the country's population. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of Beneficiary cases that received cash transfer
Percentage of beneficiaries (SWF list 2014) that received cash transfers
Percentage of beneficiaries (SWF list 2014) that verified their eligibility
Percentage of beneficiaries surveyed by the third-party monitoring who received the right benefit amount
